name: [task name]
description: Dependency Check is a Software Composition Analysis (SCA) tool that attempts to detect publicly disclosed vulnerabilities contained within a project's dependencies.
author: Dependency Check

inputs.name: projectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the project being scanned.

inputs.name: scanPath
inputs.label: Scan Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to scan. Supports Ant style paths (e.g. 'directory/**/*.jar').

inputs.name: excludePath
inputs.label: Exclude Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path patterns to exclude from the scan. Supports Ant style path patterns (e.g. /exclude/).

inputs.name: format
inputs.label: Report Format
inputs.helpMarkDown: The output format to write to (XML, HTML, CSV, JSON, JUNIT, ALL). Multiple formats can be selected. The default is HTML.

inputs.name: failOnCVSS
inputs.label: CVSS Failure Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold between 0 and 10 that will cause Dependency Check will return the exit code if a vulnerability with a CVSS score equal to or higher was identified.

inputs.name: suppressionPath
inputs.label: Suppression Paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file path to the suppression XML file used to suppress false positives. This can be specified more than once to utilize multiple suppression files. The argument can be a local file path, a URL to a suppression file, or even a reference to a file on the class path.

inputs.name: dataMirrorOdc
inputs.label: ODC Database File Mirror (odc.mv.db) URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The https path to the cached Dependency Check database file (odc.mv.db).

inputs.name: dataMirrorJson
inputs.label: JSON Repository File Mirror (jsrepository.json) URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The https path to the cached Dependency Check JSON repository file (jsrepository.json).

inputs.name: additionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pass additional command line arguments to the Dependency Check command line interface.
